results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Keith Gow, Peter Weir, Richard Brennan, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Impressions of life and industry in Australia, emphasising growth and development. The emphasis is on the great potential for growth and economic development in the 1970’s. Also involved in the production are Peter Weir who co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Mick Von Borneman as Director of photography.

results.title: Taxation office
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The workings of the Taxation Department, as explained to a young man joining the department. This film serves as an introduction to new Taxation Department staff, and gives the man in the street an insight as to how the Department functions.

results.title: Sydney's Harbour Bridge
results.brief_description: Important historical documentary which records the construction of Sydney’s Harbour Bridge from 1926 when work was first commenced through to its official opening eight year later. Features footage of dignitaries at the Opening Ceremony including the Governor General, NSW Premier (J.D. Lang) but most significantly, De Groot unceremoniously cutting the ribbon and then being taken away.

results.title: Surf Beach
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Beaches are part of the Australian way of life. Every year masses flock to the long white beaches to enjoy the sun and the surf; the thrill of riding a wave can be experienced by all on rubber floats, fibre glass malibous, or body surfing. Life saving clubs originating in Sydney and numbering some 230, play an important role in patrolling the beaches and carrying out rescue. Competitive Surf Carnivals provide exciting entertainment.

results.title: Suicide trail
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: A dramatization in the style of a “western” of how fast driving on an unfamiliar road is as sure a method of suicide as shooting oneself.

results.title: Story of a city
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of Newcastle, New South Wales, in the year of 1945, concentrating extensively on the then, and long-time, principal industries: coal mining, iron and steel, and ship building. Briefly surveys a range of contemporary domestic architectural styles and recreational choices of the time (the beach and the race track).

results.title: Steering, gear changing and braking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “How to Drive”.
Having got the feel of the car by practising starting and moving off procedures, the driver is now ready to increase speed. To attain this, demonstrates a system of steering, together with gear changing and braking techniques. While confidence and skill will grow, so too must the realisation that the safety of others is becoming increasingly dependent upon our actions and attitudes.

results.title: Starting up, moving off and stopping
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “How to Drive”.
Safe driving techniques begin even before the engine is started. Demonstrates good habits to acquire on entering the car: checking the driving position, the seat belt and all-round visibility. The procedures involved in starting, moving off and stopping are shown; confidence and ability can now be gained by practice.
